metadata.Title: CVE-2013-5123 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The mirroring support (-M, --use-mirrors) in Python Pip before 1.5 uses insecure DNS querying and authenticity checks which allows attackers to perform man-in-the-middle attacks.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-5123` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-pip - 8.1.1-2ubuntu0.4
python-pip-whl - 8.1.1-2ubuntu0.4
python3-pip - 8.1.1-2ubuntu0.4
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> This will probably require some ecosystem changes in the Python world to support authenticated PIP downloads.

criterions.comment: python-pip package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.1.1-2ubuntu0.4').
